resources.string: This app provides a simple, descriptive guide to some basic and intermediate snowboard grabs and includes a quiz to check your ability to identify different grabs.

On this chart you can see the basic grabs rider can do with his front hand. Since it is showing the position for a regular stance rider, the nose of the board is on the left and the tail is on the right and for a regular stance rider left hand is his front hand.

On this chart you can see the basic grabs rider can do with his back hand. Since it is showing the position for a regular stance rider, the nose of the board is on the left and the tail is on the right and for a regular stance rider right hand is his back hand.
Front hand grabs the "nose" of the board. The nose of the board is located at the tip of the board closer to the riders front foot.
Back hand grabs the "tail" of the board. The tail of the board is located at the tip of the board closer to the riders back foot.
Back hand grabs the toe edge of the board between the legs (the middle of the board).
Front hand grabs the toe edge of the board between the legs (the middle of the board).
Front hand grabs the heel edge between the bindings.

Method is similar to melon. It is kind of a tweaked extended version of it. Front hand grabs heel edge either between the bindings, or in front of the front binding. The front leg is bent, and the rear leg is extended (turning the board somewhat sideways) while cranking the grab across the body.
Rear hand reaches through the legs, the wrist is turned 180 degrees inward, and grabs the heel edge between the bindings.
Rear hand reaches through the legs from behind, and grabs the toe edge.
Rear hand grabs the heel edge between the bindings.
Front hand reaches across the body and grabs the tail.
Both hands grab the nose of the board.
Both hands grab the tail, with the front hand reaching in front of the body like it would during a seatbelt grab.
Congratulations, all your answers were correct, you are a PRO, now go to the mountain and do some grabs! :)
